data: Margaret had been home two hours—two hours of breathless questions, answers, tears, and laughter—two hours of delighted wandering about the house and grounds.
Margaret had been home two hours--two hours of breathless questions, answers, tears, and laughter--two hours of delighted wandering about the house and grounds.
The Turn of the Tide: The Story of How Margaret Solved Her Problem
Porter, Eleanor H. (Eleanor Hodgman), 1868-1920; Merrill, Frank T., 1848-1923 [Illustrator]
